alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 1:55PM CST until March 04 at 5:42PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County. .Runoff from rainfall accumulations of two to three inches have led to the Jacks Fork River rising above flood stage at Alley Spring. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, moderate flooding begins at the gage site. Water inundates the entire picnic area one quarter mile downstream from the gage site. At 13.0 feet, the Alley Spring Campground is completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
